p: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) concludes in its Fifth Assessment Report (AR5) that the mean global near-surface air temperature showed a warming of 0.85 Â°C for the period from 1880 to 2012 and a warming of the climate system is unequivocal [ 1]. In the Special Report on Extremes (IPCC SREX), the IPCC highlights three possible changes in extreme events due to elevated air temperature: (a) increases in the mean temperature, (b) increases in the variability and (c) changes in the symmetry of the probability distribution [ 2].
